description: Learned borrowing from Old English mǣġbōt (“compensation paid to the kinsman of a murdered man”), from mǣġ (“kinsman”) +‎ bōt (“remedy; remediation”). Compare manbote.

entries.meaning: (historical) A bot or fine paid to the near kinsmen of a slain man as compensation.
examples: If a man was slain a special manbot, or compensation for the loss of a man, had to be paid to the lord side by side with the mægbot to the kin. — NYT, Daily Lexeme: Maegbot, 2011 - (quoting H.R. Loyns, 1962)
